snippet: Symmonds, left off the United States team for the world championships, is in a marketing dispute that raises broader questions about the independence of athletes in his sport.
abstract: Runner Nick Symmonds has taken stand and spoken out against restrictive policies of USA Track & Field after being dropped from national team before 2015 world championships in Beijing; refused to sign vague contract that seemed to require athletes to wear only Nike branded attire, even in their free time, stipulation that he felt would interfere with his obligations to his sponsor Brooks Sports.
lead_paragraph: Symmonds, left off the United States team for the world championships, is in a marketing dispute that raises broader questions about the independence of athletes in his sport.

headline.main: Nick Symmonds, a Sidelined Track Star, Continues to Break From the Pack
headline.print_headline: Barred From U.S. Team, Champion Runner Likes to Break From the Pack
